articles.description: Follow live text coverage of three Premier League games, including Liverpool against Bournemouth.
articles.title: Premier League: Build-up to three games, including Liverpool v Bournemouth

articles.description: BBC TV coverage and live text from the World Athletics Championships in Budapest as Britain's Zharnel Hughes begins his bid for 100m gold.
articles.title: Watch: World Championships - GB's Hughes & Johnson-Thompson in action

articles.description: The Lionesses will become the first England side since 1966 to win a senior final on the global stage if they defeat Spain at Stadium Australia in Sydney on Sunday.
articles.title: England v Spain World Cup final: What you need to know

articles.description: Ange Postecoglou enjoys his first Premier League win as Tottenham manager thanks to two second-half goals against Manchester United.
articles.title: Spurs beat Man Utd to earn Postecoglou first win

articles.description: England forward Billy Vunipola is sent off as Ireland secure a major momentum boost before the World Cup by scoring five tries in a comfortable win.
articles.title: Vunipola sent off as Ireland beat England in Dublin

articles.description: Watch as 10,000m race leader Sifan Hassan of the Netherlands falls yards from the finish line and misses out on a medal at the World Championships in Budapest.
articles.title: Watch: 10,000m leader Hassan trips yards from finish

articles.description: Liverpool fight back from conceding an early goal to overpower Bournemouth in a hugely entertaining match at Anfield.
articles.title: Liverpool fight back to beat Bournemouth with 10 men

articles.description: World champions South Africa produce an eight-try demolition to beat an experimental and inexperienced Wales 52-16 in Saturday's World Cup warm-up in Cardiff.
articles.title: Wales slump to record defeat against South Africa

articles.description: England have to "play the game of our lives" if they are to win the Women's World Cup, says captain Millie Bright.
articles.title: England have to play 'game of our lives' - Bright

articles.description: BBC Sport pundits Alex Scott, Fara Williams and Ellen White discuss whether Lauren James should be recalled to England's starting line-up for the Women's World Cup final against Spain.
articles.title: Should James start? - Pundits on World Cup final
